channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Behavior of Crowds not Wisdom of Crowds
item.description: When behavioral crowds are roiling the markets, as they are now, best idea active equity has an excellent chance of outperforming.

item.title: Warren Buffet-backed BYD’s ultra-affordable EVs are struggling in one market: Japan
item.description: BYD’s sales have been lukewarm since entering the Japanese passenger vehicle market, where it faces a rebound in the popularity of hybrids and loyalty to domestic brands like Toyota.

item.title: Is the Outright Ban on a US Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) a Mistake?
item.description: Instead of outright banning a US CBDC, wouldn’t it be preferrable to establish clear and enforceable legislative guardrails?

item.title: Top investor dubs U.K. a ‘banana economy’ with a ‘build absolutely nothing anywhere near anything’ mantra
item.description: PIC says the U.K.'s stunted planning policy is leaving $250 billion for viable projects unused.

item.title: Concerned About Market Concentration and Lofty Valuations? Consider Small Caps
item.description: Investors are showing increased concern about large-cap stocks due to high market concentration and lofty stock valuations. Other factors combine to make a compelling case for small caps.

item.title: Netflix wants managers to ask themselves whether they would rehire their current employees—and fire them, if the answer is ‘no’
item.description: "We encourage everyone to speak to their managers about what’s going well and what’s not on a regular basis. This helps avoid surprises."

item.title: What Is Systems Thinking? A Primer with Applications for Sustainable Investing
item.description: Systems thinking is gaining in popularity in many fields including economics, finance, and investment management. Learn what it means and how it's being applied to sustainable investing.

item.title: The U.K.’s wine business is booming, so much so that Britain’s largest winemaker is considering putting itself up for sale to fund expansion
item.description: Founded 22 years ago, Chapel Down has witnessed the U.K.’s wine business boom as climate change wreaked havoc on other traditional wine-producing hubs.

item.title: Book Review: My Value Creation Journey
item.description: Bartley J. Madden has produced a book that challenges business leaders and investment professionals to think outside the box systematically to solve difficult problems.

item.title: Hip-hop star Megan Thee Stallion is promoting Amazon’s 10th annual Prime Day with a new original song called—surprise—‘It’s Prime Day’
item.description: On Tuesday, the rapper unveiled a new original song called “It’s Prime Day.” An accompanying music video shows her purchasing a pink dog collar, fake eyelashes and other items from Amazon.
